alert.note: Alert for Bear River Range (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 12 at 11:55AM MST until January 13 at 2:00AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM SATURDAY TO 5 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches, except 2 to 9 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 17 inches, except 7 to 22 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes. * WHERE...Bear River Range, including but not limited to Emigration Summit. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 2 AM MST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 5 PM Saturday to 5 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing and drifting snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: For the Blizzard Warning, travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the Winter Storm Warning, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting 511.idaho.gov.
